ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of poetic influence, how poets interact with each other, how poetry changes. A deep sense of the value of poetry and art, and a feeling for verse in general.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Meeting over Skype and not in person, though manageable, was not ideal.

A moving, powerful, important course that connects the student with poetry and hence with the self, the world, with love. The only fault with the course, and it is a serious one, is that we were forced by the administration to do it over Skype. We had met Prof. Bloom in person during the Fall term, and seeing him in person was meaningful. I wish bureaucratic chiseling weren't allowed to hurt student experience.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely Prof. Bloom is incredible, the poetry is wonderful, and the the scope of the works we go through is comprehensive.
It's the anxiety of influence, with the very man who invented the concept. Take it.
Absolutely...it's a life-changing course with an amazing syllabus and an amazing instructor.
